name: Veg Handi
history: Veg Handi is a traditional Indian dish cooked in a 'Handi,' a deep and wide-mouthed cooking vessel. It's known for its rich, creamy texture and the blend of spices and vegetables.
description: Veg Handi is a delicious mix of various vegetables cooked in a creamy gravy. The dish combines a variety of spices and ingredients to create a rich and flavorful curry, often served with Indian bread or rice.

instructions.title: Prepare Vegetables
instructions.description: Wash all the vegetables. Cut the cauliflower into florets, dice the carrots, potatoes, and bell peppers, and chop the green beans. Set aside.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a handi or heavy-bottomed pot. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Then, add the finely chopped onions and sautÃ© until they turn translucent. Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and sautÃ© for another minute.

instructions.title: Add Vegetables and Spices
instructions.description: Add the prepared vegetables to the pot. Sprinkle turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt over the vegetables. SautÃ© for 5-7 minutes.

instructions.title: Cook with Tomato Puree
instructions.description: Pour in the tomato puree and mix well. Cover the pot and let it cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables start to soften.

instructions.title: Add Cream and Cashew Paste
instructions.description: Stir in the cream and cashew paste into the curry. This will give the dish a rich and creamy texture. If the curry is too thick, add a little water to adjust the consistency.

instructions.title: Final Seasoning
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala and kasuri methi over the curry. Stir and let it simmer for another 5 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Turn off the heat and garnish the Veg Handi with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Adjust the amount of chili powder and cream according to your taste preferences.
You can also add other vegetables of your choice, like mushrooms or paneer.
variations: To make it vegan, use coconut cream instead of dairy cream.
Add a bit of lemon juice at the end for a tangy flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2-3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on the stove or in a microwave.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm, adding a little water if the curry has thickened.

presentationTips: Serve in a traditional handi or bowl to enhance the visual appeal.
Garnish with a dollop of cream or butter for a richer presentation.
